citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult male rabbit (“Thumper”) has brownish crusts in the left ear, extending about a fourth of the way up the ear. The
adjacent skin is pink and the ear canal is narrowed by the excessive buildup of crusts. This condition had not been
identified by the facility prior to the inspection. Crusty buildup in the ear can be a sign of infection or parasite infestation,
and can cause discomfort for the animal. Correct by contacting the Attending Veterinarian (AV) for assessment of the
animal’s condition and by following all treatment instructions from the AV.

The licensee did not have records of acquisition for the Animal Welfare Act regulated animals on site during the
inspection. Recordkeeping is important for animal traceability in the event of disease outbreak or animal escapes or theft.
Correct by maintaining records that contain the name and address of the person from whom the animal was acquired,
along with their USDA certificate number (or driver’s license number and vehicle tag number if they do not possess a
USDA certificate), as well as the date of acquisition and species of animal.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and a family member.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An adult male rabbit (“Thumper”) has brownish crusts in the left ear, extending about a fourth of the way up the ear. The 
adjacent skin is pink and the ear canal is narrowed by the excessive buildup of crusts. This condition had not been 
identified by the facility prior to the inspection. Crusty buildup in the ear can be a sign of infection or parasite infestation, 
and can cause discomfort for the animal. Correct by contacting the Attending Veterinarian (AV) for assessment of the 
animal’s condition and by following all treatment instructions from the AV. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee did not have records of acquisition for the Animal Welfare Act regulated animals on site during the 
inspection. Recordkeeping is important for animal traceability in the event of disease outbreak or animal escapes or theft. 
Correct by maintaining records that contain the name and address of the person from whom the animal was acquired, 
along with their USDA certificate number (or driver’s license number and vehicle tag number if they do not possess a 
USDA certificate), as well as the date of acquisition and species of animal. 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection.

This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.  
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.  
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.  
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and a family member.
